title: Easily Delete Cache and Cookies in the MS Edge Web Browser

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu in Microsoft Edge ••• .
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu in Microsoft Edge ••• . You'll see these three horizontal dots at the top-right corner of Edge on your PC. Clearing your Edge cache and cookies on your PC only clears the files from your computer. However, if you also clear your browsing history , you'll be clearing your history from all devices on which you use Edge. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Optional: If you use Edge on other devices and don't want to clear the cache on those devices, you'll want to turn off Sync first. Click Profiles on the three-dot menu, choose Sync , then select Turn off Sync .

steps.title: Click Setttings.
steps.content: Click Setttings . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy, search, and services.
steps.content: Click Privacy, search, and services . This option is in the left panel toward the top of the window.

steps.title: Click the Choose what to clear button under "Clear browsing data."
steps.content: Click the Choose what to clear button under "Clear browsing data." This expands the "Clear browsing data" window.

steps.title: Select All time from the "Time range" menu.
steps.content: Select All time from the "Time range" menu. By default, Last hour is selected, which means you'll only be clearing the cache you've accumulated for the last hour of use. Click the menu and select All time to clear your entire cache.

steps.title: Uncheck the items you don't want to delete.
steps.content: Uncheck the items you don't want to delete. If you only want to clear your cache, remove the checkmarks from all items except for "Cached images and files." If you want to clear other data, like your browsing history, cookies , or site permissions, check those boxes. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear now.
steps.content: Click Clear now . This clears your browsing cache (and any other data you've selected) from Microsoft Edge.

steps.title: Click the Microsoft Edge menu in the menu bar.
steps.content: Click the Microsoft Edge menu in the menu bar. You'll see this at the top-left corner of your Mac's screen while Edge is open. When you clear your cache and/or cookies in Edge on your Mac, you'll only be deleting those files from your Mac—not other devices. However, if you opt to delete your browsing history, your history will be removed from all other devices on which you use Edge.

steps.title: Click Clear Browsing Data….
steps.content: Click Clear Browsing Data… . It's near the top of the menu. You can also access this area quickly using the keyboard shortcut Shift + Cmd + Del , which also works in other browsers like Safari and Chrome.

steps.title: Select All time from the "Time range" menu.
steps.content: Select All time from the "Time range" menu. By default, Last hour is selected, which means you'll only be clearing the cache you've accumulated for the last hour of use. Click the menu and select All time to clear your entire cache.

steps.title: Uncheck the items you don't want to delete.
steps.content: Uncheck the items you don't want to delete. If you only want to clear your cache, remove the checkmarks from all items except for "Cached images and files." If you want to clear other data, like your browsing history, cookies , or site permissions, check those boxes. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear now.
steps.content: Click Clear now . This clears your browsing cache (and any other data you've selected) from Microsoft Edge. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu in Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu in Microsoft Edge. You'll see these three horizontal dots in Edge on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Clearing your Edge cache and cookies on your phone or tablet only deletes the files from your Android, iPhone, or iPad. If you also want to clear your browsing history, you'll be deleting your history from all devices on which you use Edge.

steps.title: Tap Privacy and security.
steps.content: Tap Privacy and security . It's near the top of the menu. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Clear browsing data . It's the first option on the menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select All Time from the "Time range" menu.
steps.content: Select All Time from the "Time range" menu. This ensures that you'll be deleting your entire cache rather than just the files from the past hour.

steps.title: Select the data you want to delete.
steps.content: Select the data you want to delete. You'll see a checkmark next to each item that's set to be cleared. If you only want to clear your cache on Edge, tap other items that are checked to remove the checkmarks. If you also want to clear cookies or your browsing history, leave those items checked.

steps.title: Tap Clear now.
steps.content: Tap Clear now . It's at the bottom of the screen. A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Tap Clear now to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Clear now to confirm. This clears your Edge browsing cache.
